result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $5,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Marisa F. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 1900 block of Northport Dr. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

Court reporter Paige Reardon. Defendant Antoine B Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Dorothea Claire Watson in court for Antoine B Johnson.  Attorney Lillian Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a bail/bond hearing after DCPS violations and return on warrant in cases 21CF1449, 22CF2032 and 22CF2033. State requests that cash bond be forfeited in 21CF1449 and 22CF2032. State requests $5,000 per case and gives argument. Atty Watson gives argument. Victim CC makes a statement. Court makes findings and orders as follows: 

21CF1449- Court orders posted cash bail in the amount of $3,500 to be forfeited. Court orders $5,000 cash bail, with DCPS for GPS and remote breath. All other bail conditions will remain the same. 

22CF2032-Court orders posted cash bail in the amount of $1,000 to be forfeited. Court orders $5,000 cash bail, with DCPS for GPS and remote breath. All other bail conditions will remain the same. 

22CF2033-Court orders $5,000 cash bail, with DCPS for GPS and remote breath. All other bail conditions will remain the same.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Antoine B Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Dorothea Claire Watson in court for Antoine B Johnson.  Attorney Carl Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. A speedy trial demand has been filed in this case. Court will issue a signature bond in this case. All other bail conditions will remain the same.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Antoine B Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Dorothea Claire Watson in court for Antoine B Johnson.  Attorney Carl Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim family gives statement. Atty Watson gives argument. State objects to modification of bail and gives argument. Court will grant a signature bond in this case, which will render the speedy trial demand moot. Court will issue trial dates in this case.
